================================================================================

41392165^CT Abdomen + Pelvis w/ Contrasthttps://pacs.smithcohosp.org/pacs/wado.php?mode=4&id_1=804678213&viewer=1F20230402094530.102
                                                            
Indication: Gallbladder drain, increasing pain
Discussion: There is a drain under the liver which has good 
position in the gallbladder which is decompressed.  Spleen 
is not enlarged.  There is a moderate right pleural 
effusion, only partially seen.  Mild cardiomegaly is 
present.  Some right lower lung atelectasis is seen.  Upper 
anterior abdominal wall hernia has some fat in a slight 
bulge of the distal greater curve of the stomach.  Pancreas 
is not enlarged.  Adrenals appear negative.  Right upper 
anterior kidney has a small lesion that measures about 2.2 
cm and seems to contain some fat and soft tissue, probably 
an angiomyolipoma.  No hydronephrosis is seen.  Right lower 
kidney has a small cyst.
There are some degenerative changes and osteoporosis in the 
spine.  There is mild bilateral hip arthritis.
Impression: 
1.  Gallbladder is decompressed with a drain and has good 
appearance and positioning.
2.  Small upper anterior abdominal wall hernia with some 
fat in minimal part of the distal stomach.  There are no 
signs of obstruction.
3.  Upper anterior right kidney lesion is unchanged.
4.  Right renal cyst.
5.  Minimal diverticulosis.
6.  Moderate prostate enlargement.
7.  Mild cardiomegaly.
8.  Small right effusion and atelectasis.
